body.description: This lightweight, retro-style dry iron prevents your arm from strain even during long use. Adjust the temperature dial according to the type of cloth you are ironing. Low: is about 80-120 °C. Medium: is about 140-160 °C. High: is about 180-200 °C.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No steam iron that's really great.
reviews.reviewText: It's lightweight, heats up quick. I keep distilled water in a spray bottle and mist my clothes before ironing. The writing on it is not in English, but easy enough to figure it out. A really great little iron.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love it!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because I was sick of steam irons that leak and ruin my clothing, this iron had great reviews so I decided to give it a try. It is amazing!! It irons better than a steam iron, but without the mess. It is small and light weight. The settings are not in English, but it isn't hard to figure out. I highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Gets hot really fast
reviews.reviewText: This iron is great for my quilting projects. Smaller design and heats up fast. Only drawback is the instructions were all in Japanese, so was the settings on the iron. All in all great iron

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A light weight, charmingly simple effective iron
reviews.reviewText: I am very pleased to find this delightful small light weight iron. I spray my fabrics with a little water if I want and the iron removed all wrinkles. The dial is not in english but it is easy to decide where to set the temperature control. The cord in long enough. It is so nice to have a simple to use, very workable iron at last.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best iron I've ever owned!
reviews.reviewText: I LOVE this iron! I wanted a dry iron with a flat sole plate for quilting cotton. Steam irons ALWAYS leak given enough time (about 9 months for me). This is true for all the irons I've had, both expensive and not. I switched to using these irons without water, misting the fabric instead. However, gunk builds up in the steam holes even if you don't use water in the iron (misting the fabric creates steam when the iron passes over the fabric) and the gunk is eventually deposited on (usually light colored) fabric. This iron has a completely flat plate and I no longer have to worry about my iron spitting stuff.Heads up: the instructions and markings on the iron are all in Japanese except for the word "Panasonic". This isn't a problem for me because it's pretty obvious what's low, medium, and high but if you want your iron markings in English, this won't do it for you.The iron gets plenty hot! I saw a review that said it doesn't get hot enough. I'm not sure what they were trying to iron, but mine is more than hot enough for quilting cotton. I sometimes turn it down if it's too hot for spray starch. I don't know how it works ironing delicate fabrics at lower temps because I don't.The sole plate is non-stick and very easy to clean. I clean it once in a while when starch builds up (I use regular iron cleaning paste I got from Amazon). I accidentally knocked it onto a platic bag which melted on the plate but the plastic came right off. I suppose you might have to worry about scratching it if ironing around pins, buttons, zippers, etc., but I don't know because I've only used it on plain fabric.It is lightweight which is a plus and a minus. A minus because it's easy to knock over (see above about the plastic bag). Also, I may need to apply pressue when pressing a thick seam. It's a plus because it's not heavy which is great for arthritic hands and wrists.Caution: there is no auto-off in any position. This is a plus and a minus. Plus because the iron is always hot. Minus because safety. I stay very aware of it and so far I haven't left it on or scorched any fabric. If it falls, say on a plastic bag, it won't switch off. If you're super forgetful and rely on an iron to switch off, this isn't the iron for you.In summary, this is the best iron I've ever owned and I wouldn't hesitate to get another (especially because the price is reasonable).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a dry iron and this Panasonic is the perfect iron. It is very lightweight, heats up quickly and irons out all the wrinkles quickly. Cost more than some of the mass market irons but it is worth every dollar. Heat settings are in Japanese but it is very easy to figure out the dial

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not made in Japan
reviews.reviewText: The iron arrived on time and undamaged.It is smaller and lighter than a standard iron which is nice to get into creases and between buttons. The sole plate is smooth and fully visible so one can see exactly where on the fabric the iron is. No auto switch off, is a feature i was looking for and one of the primary reasons why i bought this. This iron gets hot quickly and keeps the heat it is set on; the heat settings are accurate. The Japanese instructions were no issue, Google Translate handled that very nicely, should they be needed or wanted. A slightly longer cord would be nice but the cord is not so short that it wont reach the end of the ironing board easily.Reason for the 3star review: The description clearly and prominently states this iron is made in Japan. This is not true. This iron is made in Malaysia , which is not an issue to me. What is an issue is that the product description specifically states : “ Made in Japan” ( to give the perception of quality) but the engraving on the butt of the iron states : “Made in Malaysia “.Keep lying, keep getting 3 star reviews.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great iron. Gets hot quickly.
reviews.reviewText: Was so happy to find this iron. I prefer a dry iron. This one is great!
La Plancha es pequeña pero muy útil para uso en casa
this is one of the best product i have ever purchased on amazon so light weight so reasonably priced works so well can carry it in your handbag if you are travelling i just love it
スチームアイロンの目詰まりのため次はスチームなしで新しいものを探していました。評価が高かったのでこちらにしてみましたが、シンプルな構造なうえにスチームなしにもかかわらず仕上がりが断然きれい！買い替えてよかったです。

No hubo ningún inconveniente con el envío considerando que es un producto que viene desde Japón, la plancha funciona a la perfección y fue necesario utilizar ningún tipo de adaptador ni ningún tipo de modificación.

reviews.reviewTitle: 立ち上がり早くて使いやすい
reviews.reviewText: 小物作りの為に購入。軽くて扱いやすいです。スチームはついていませんが小物作りではあまり必要ありませんし、シワを伸ばしたい時は水をスプレーするので問題ありません。自動OFF機能もありませんが、立ち上がりが早いのでこまめに切って使っています。ただ本体の上側の金属部分も熱くなるので初心者や扱い慣れてない人は少し怖いかもしれません。耐久性に期待したいです。
